data.title: A beautiful place with amazing food
data.text: This building is the perfect setting for luncheons and wedding or baby showers.  Cathy and her staff make some amazing appetizers, refreshing teas, and delicious entrees that cannot be found anywhere else in Odessa.  My girlfriends and I eat here as often as we can and when we have teacher trainings downtown, we are sure to take the time to visit Dee's Bistro.

data.title: Not 'Dee' Best
data.text: My coworker and I went for lunch. Because I am a simple eater, I did a cheeseburger. My order was not correct when the food came but it wasn't a big deal at all. The cheese that was placed on the burger seemed to be a shredded mixture of cheese for a taco. The pretzel-style bun was a joy and the burger was tantalizing over. My coworker's sandwich was too overcooked. The place is decent but not a place I need to revisit.

data.title: LOVE
data.text: I Love Dee's, have eaten there many times and it was fantastic. The atmosphere is magnificent and there is not another menue like it in Odessa.

data.title: Dee's
data.text: Not very good. Anyone can open a package of frozen veg. and that is ok if you season them But they didn't even wash the frost off them. The steak was ok. It was off the grill. not cook right. Just wont go back. and that was 2 years ago.

data.title: Go to Yana's instead
data.text: I did not care for Dee's. I have tried it two different times.. The first time I went with some ladies on a reunion committee and the chicken salad I had tasted like it was a bought chicken salad, not made fresh. That was in 2002 summer time. The second time was with my sister. Had a steak, that was fair and the vegies were frozen and they did not bother the wash the frost off or season them. One thing for sure, IF you are going to open a food place Please try to cook all things fresh. Nothing worst than going to one and seeing the food Sam's wholesale furnishes. The first time shame on them and the second time shame on me, guess what no 3rd time. Un less under new owners.

data.title: A nice change!
data.text: Dee's Bistro has such a neat atmosphere compared to what is the norm in Odessa.  I love that the museum was turned into a cute little bistro because it is a great change of scenery.

data.title: Dee's Bistro Dinner Theater
data.text: We attended one of Dee's Bistro dinner theaters, Murder at the Telethon (Aug 17, 2013). Both the meal and the show were fantastic! There were 6 of us. The show was great and the chef accommodated 3 of us with a  strict gluten-free diet. They went the extra mile for customer service and satisfaction. We look forward to a return visit. Highly recommended!

data.title: A yummy lunch place
data.text:
Dee's Bistro is a great place for a lunch! They have bread served with tomato, olive mixed with basil for dipping the bread into while you select your meal that is yummy. Randy & Cathy that own the restaurant try to put you at ease right away when you enter their place. This sweet couple serve up wonderful sandwiches for lunch along with very nice salads. They have a different twist on their sandwiches that make them special. Course their Light Creamy Chicken Salad is very good but I also love their Southwest Club that has smoked ham, turkey, avocado & smoked Gouda cheese. They top this with Chipotle sauce like spread. Yummy!!!
  When I want just veggies for a dish but not a salad I love ordering their Grilled Portabella which is a large mushroom that's been marinated , grilled & then filled with lettuce, tomato, & topped with a cream spread with capers in it! Warning, this dish seems to be a favorite of others cause they do sometimes sell out of them. 
   They serve sweet potato fries with a lot of their lunch plates. These are more like straw than fries because of them being so thin. But they serve them with a sweet sauce & together it is one of the best things they make there. I just love them!!! Very good!!!
   Something that the Bistro Grill has started doing the last few months is being open on Friday nights. They serve a different fare on evenings with steak & chicken or fish dishes. We love their fried green beans served with dill sauce! My husband & I could make that a meal just on those! They are so very good!! 
  They also serve a wonderful beef medallions with a red wine reduction sauce over it!!! Oh boy is that good! Makes me hungry just talking on this site about their food!! 
   They also have now & then dinner & play nights where there will be a play performed while you eat. In the back part of the restaurant is a small stage for this & for other performers to come & play guitars, keyboards & other instruments. You never know what you'll find there. Many times they have either instructors of music from the near by colleges near by or their students who are pretty good themselves. 
  If you've never tried Dee's Bistro Grill then I suggest you do! You most likely will agree with me it is a very nice place to eat & visit. It's on the corner of Lee & 7th street where the old Presidental Museum use to be. If you go to the Bapitist Church in Down town Odessa, it is right across the street from there, ( to give a reference point). Hope you give this Christian couple's restaurant a try! You'll be glade you did.
